DOC.detailed_description: This study investigate effect Osmotic-Release Oral System ( OROS ) -methylphenidate , long-acting stimulant , multiple dimension attention work memory . Specifically , investigate follow two hypothesis : ( 1 ) OROS-methylphenidate result improve performance measure assess multiple domain attention , include sustained attention , attentional control , selective attention , divide attention , ( 2 ) OROS-methylphenidate result improve performance measure work memory . In addition use study collect pilot data whether magnitude effect OROS-methylphenidate varies across different component attention work memory whether improvement across measure helpful predict parent teacher rating improvement .
